rComments: Jan is one of my fav teachers! His lectures contain a LOT of material, but if you pay attention, take good notes, and review the slides, you will do well in his class. His tests are difficult, but the curve is generous. He truly challenges his students and you have to work for an A, but its very doable. I would take any class taught by Jan!

Jan's funny and very passionate about the subject and his lectures are all the better for it. However, section is boring as hell (a complete waste of time to be fair) but go you must as there are quizzes each week. His tests are designed to make you feel like an idiot, but the curve is generous so you'll get whatever grade you deserve in the end.

Jan is a great teacher and has a bit of a dry humor haha. He gave a lot of insect examples; his examples were always interesting. Just attend lectures and review your notes before each test and you'll be fine. The textbook isn't really necessary, but even though he posts the slides, I recommend the lectures. He's friendly if you have questions.

Jan is an amazing lecturer and gives fantastic examples during lecture. I am not an envs major and was taking this class for the science GE which I do regret. Although Jan is amazing, his tests are just ridiculous. I've always been the student to get straight As but ended up with a B in this class because the tests are just impossible.

Jan gives amazing lectures that make you want to show up to class! He is able to teach the class using examples from his own experience and the environment that is the UCSC campus. Although I am a freshman, Jan has taught me more than any teacher I have had previously. This class is hard but Jan is a very fare grader. You won't be disappointed!
Goes fast in lectures

Jan is a great teacher. Really passionate about what he teaches and teaches it well. Not necessary to buy the book, necessary to go to class. Everything on the exams was covered during lecture. The exams were tough but her curves them enough that everybody I know still passed the class.

Amazing class!  Jan is such a great lecturer, he was always adding his own personal stories to make things more interesting!  He loves the subject matter and it shows!  Hard exams, basically every questions is a trick question, but most of the information comes from his lecture slides so it is possible to do well, he also GREATLY curves them.

Jan knows everything about anything living. His depth of knowledge and crazy enthusiasm are extremely engaging. The 1hr. 45min. lecture was actually enjoyable because Jan is so stoked on what he does. Be prepared to study a lot of flash cards and you'll ace the tests.
Great teacher!

This was such a great class to take & I'll definitely miss it. He's very organized with the powerpoints he uses to teach. He's a witty, fascinating, passionate, patient person. The tests are curved generously. I read the book until the first midterm, but got by without it after that because the ppts are so straightforward.

Jan is by far the best professor I've had at UCSC! He's very passionate about what he is teaching and is funny! He makes you interested in nature, especially bugs. Curves a lot and no homework, the key is to go to lecture. Overall a great experience, would recommend!

I'm not interested in ecology but Jan is great and his passion for the field really shows. Tests can be tricky but he curves a lot. Also not a ton of homework and the reading isnt mandatory. It's key to go to lecture.

Professor Washburn is a phenomenal teacher and is willing to help anyone that comes to his office hours.  The sections for class are great and the TA's are helpful as well.  He is very enthusiastic about ecology.  I would highly recommend taking this class.

Jan is a fantastic professor. Definitely go talk to him during office hours because he is very helpful. I am so glad I took this class and I would recommend it to everyone, even if they aren't an ENVS major.

I love Jan!  He is very passionate about his work which makes the class relevant and interesting.  The tests are challenging but he curves really nicely so you should have to worry too much about that.  I suggest going to ALL the lectures because this is the material that he tests.

Incredibly eloquent speaker, keeps class interesting, very funny, fair on tests.  Reading the textbook isn't necessary but it is helpful, all the test material comes from lecture slides. You'll want to go to every class! It's important to go to class to hear the examples - theyre not always explained on the lecture slides

Very nice guy. Email him and go to office hours whenever you need help or have questions. He is very funny. Lectures can get a little boring but try and pay attention so you have less studying to do. Pay attention to his examples! They help. Go to every section and test review. They give out answers there!
Great professor. Effective teaching methods. Really enjoyed his class. He expects a lot but its all very interesting and relevant.

Jan is probably the best professor I have had at UCSC so far. He knows the material so well he makes it interesting for everyone else. I enjoy going to class everyday because I learn so many awesome things about nature. This class takes a bit of focus, but you will learn so many cool things. I highly recommend this professor. Jan is the best!

Very engaging prof. especially for a summer class that was 3.5 hrs, I'm not a science person but he brings in real life examples from santa cruz area that makes it interesting. Hard tests but you can do well if you study. Attending all lectures is a must to do well. Didn't really need to read the book to do well. Helps you outside of class
Jan is an exceptional professor.  He uses wonderful examples and engages the class in all of his lectures. His tests are tricky, but if you study hard enough you will definitely succeed.

Jan was awesome!  I loved this class!  His tests were tricky, but if you study hard enough, you should be able to pull off an A.  Lectures were long, but nonetheless intresting and he always let us out early.  He was enthusiastic about the subject and his own personal experience in the field made the class that much more fun.

He took a class/text which had the potential to be very boring and made it interesting (Come on-you know you hate doing life tables). Nice guy/engaging. Used really cool examples from the campus. His tests are worded to trick you, but on the plus side it was mult choice (though his summer class was short answer). One HW assignment.

I felt that this class was very interesting. Jan used such AWESOME examples, most of which were from the UCSC campus. The only problem I had with this class was that the exams are tricky in the wording. BEWARE... read questions thoroughly. Peace Out G!

Sometimes his lectures can put you to sleep, but in general he is a very good lecturer.  He finds amazing case studies to prove his points, and has a good sense of humor (in a scientist kind of way).  He writes some tricky exam questions, but grades fairly.  Very little homework.

His class is interesting and though he may seem stern at first, he really is funny in a very dry sort of way. Only problem is that his tests are difficult to do well on, and mostly just because of the way he tricks you up with words, or switching axis on a graph, etc. Learning his testing style is key, and something I have yet been able  to do...

Jan is absolutely lovely. If he can tell you care about endangered butterflies as much as he does it will probably help your grade. i.e. go to class... Tests can be a bit specific so just study and pay attention!
Very good professor, very interested in the subject. His tests are hard though, I really had to study. But he curves, and is generous about which scores he uses for your grade. Very good class!

Awesome instructor. Clever, dry humor. You either get it, or it goes completely over your head. Likes trick questions for exams, but not a problem if you do all you're supposed to. Really cool guy, really interesting class. VERY PASSIONATE PROFESSOR.
Jan is so knowledgeable about everything related to the environment and animal physiology. His genuine interest rubs off on his students. His stories and tidbits of information are hilarious.

Jan is an awesome teacher.  He is passionate and interesting and he really knows the material.  The tests are difficult- study the lecture notes and know real world examples.  The book is helpful, but you don't have to read.  The beginning of the class is boring, but it gets better.  His study guides are helpful, but know how to apply concepts.

I completely disagree that test didnt reflect class material. THey were tricky yes, but the mult choice required you to actually know terms & be able to apply them to them to real examples. Attending lectures is a must because he does casually say crucial information that will help you on the test. Plus he wears shorts & sandals all year, cant hate

He is VERY passionate about the subject, although I still found the material to be rather dry. I got Bs on all the tests by reading the powerpoints and review sheet the night before the test. Read test questions carefully. Jan is a great professor!

Jan is VERY intelligent and really knows what he's talking about and obviously is very passionate about his line of work and his studies. However, the class is pretty boring unless you have a really big previous interest in the subject. Staying focused was definitely really hard for me in this class, which usually isn't an issue. He's nice though!
He is an AWESOME teacher! Very passionate, loves to teach, and you can tell he loves the subject. I'm a psych major and I loved this class. I highly recommend this class!!

Washburn is awesome.  The tests are curved.  So much so that an 88 was the top score, a 68 was a B, and 50 was a C.  All the complainers just don't like to study.  One of the best classes I've had at UCSC.

This class was deceptively difficult. When I took it, half the class failed as a final grade. Although Prof. Washburn gave fairly good lectures and he was easy to follow, his test were BRUTAL, and although he curves them, I feel that they do not accurately represent what we learned in the class. Other than his tests, he is fairly avaiable and helps

Very interesting class, sorta a must-take at UCSC.  The tests are brutal, but he curves the hell out of them. Great lectures, very funny at times.  Don't get scared off by the excessively creepy bug pictures the first couple lectures -- it gets better

I really wish Jan taught more ENVS classes--I would take them all! Such an engaging and intelligent lecturer. 'Twas my favorite class I've taken so far in college (sophmore). How I miss that man already!

He is an awesome professor! He really loves his job and it's really apparent. His grading is easy because he'll give you an A if he sees that you're improving from midterm to midterm. He started tearing up during his final lecture and it was really motivating. Made me want to save the world! Interesting class, you should take it!
Great teacher, anyone know what his website is? Where are his powerpoint lectures online?? HELP PLEASE!  thanks

Dynamic lecturer, and I loved his humor. His tests are a bit tricky, but HW is minimal. He puts all his powerpoint lectures online, super helpful; to fully understand you'll have to attend lecture but I wanted to anyway. Great class.

It helps to use a voice recorder in class because he goes fast. his tests are hard but he does curve a little.My opinion def changed throughout the qrtr. this guy is very knowledgeable about what hes teaching and i nearly cried during his last lecture; it was so touching how passionate he is about the earth and trying to change it for the better.

He is an amzing professor! He is so fascinated by the natural world, and his appreciation is contagious! Very funny, in a subtle and sarcastic way. All the photos he shows in his lecture slides HE TOOK! Discussion is difficult (as are tests) but my TA (Biao Zhu) was very helpful. Makes you remember how incredible life on earth really is!

He is kinda boring, could have been more exciting. His tests are tricky but get someone's tests that took the class before( he lets you keep the test) and study them really hard because he reuses a lot of the same questions.

Jan Washburn is a complete and total ecology SAVAGE. He's the most amazing wealth of information and absolutely inspires me. The class is a little dense and the tests are tricky, but a little respect for him and the material goes a long way. If you don't take it, at least try to meet the guy because he ROCKS.
